result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy T. Shorter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy T. Shorter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy T. Shorter was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Jeremy T. Shorter was found guilty of Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • Jeremy T. Shorter was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Jeremy T. Shorter was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have contact with Jennifer S, KLS 11/22/02, JTS 9/20/08 & JTS 6/30/10, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Register as a Sex Offender for 15 years.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody on writ with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath. Victim present in court.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  204 -   Victim rights compliance. ADA Zapf states PSI did not include all information re: the SA charges - supplemental reports provided to the Court. Atty Hertz-McGrath does not believe an updated PSI is necessary, as the Court can use the supplemental reports as the factual basis. No objection from either side to use of reports. Court reviews documents in the presence of the parties. All parties prepared to proceed to sentencing. Sentencing recommendations. Sentence:
Ct3:   Defendant is sentenced to 9 years in the WSP; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to all other counts.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Ct5:    Defendant is sentenced to 18 years in the WSP; 10 years Initial Confinement followed by 8 years of Extended Supervision.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Ct6:   Defendant is sentenced to 18 years in the WSP; 10 years Initial Confinement followed by 8 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to Ct5.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Ct11:  Defendant is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to Cts 5, 6.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
No contact with Jennifer S., KLS 11/22/02, JTS 9/20/08, JTS 6/30/10. Restitution of $558 ordered - order signed in court. DE to register as a S.O. for 15 years. Court costs ordered. DE ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge. Appeals rights, Voters rights, Firearms warning given.
Acknowledgment of plea offer/agreement.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  300 -   Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved. DE enters plea of no contest to Cts 3, 5, 6, 11 - found guilty by the Court. (Guilty pleas on Cts 5 & 6 are without the weapons enhancer.)  Cts 8, 15, 17, 18, 23 dismissed & read-in for sentencing. All remaining counts dismissed outright. PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
At the request of Atty Hertz-McGrath's office, FPT rescheduledto 2/2/17 @ 3pm. Attys confirm by email. DA's office notified to cancel writ for 12/20.
At the request of Atty Hertz-McGrath's office, FPT rescheduled to 12/20/16 @ 2pm due to a personal emergency. Attys confirm by email.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1015 -   Victim rights compliance.  Atty Hertz-McGrath requests adjournment to allow for offer review. Granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  218 -   Victim rights compliance. ST has tendered an offer for resolution. Atty Hertz-McGrath requests an adjournment to consider the offer made. Granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
NO RECORD MADE. Hearing rescheduled prior to court due to atty illness. Date to be coordinated by clerk.

Information filed, reading waived.  Not Guilty pleas entered. Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Bond - continued.
